comment: He makes lab class super easy. I swear he doesn't even grades his labs. he's also a chill guy to talk too and he's super caring. Sadly, he is leaving to teach in another country but he was such a good lab professor.

Have you ever met a prof who knew everyone's names in a tripple-digit sized class? Kayode is great. He lectures well and his tests are straightforward. He's a laid back guy who wants to see you succeed but won't micromanage everything you do. Just study and do the homework and you'll be fine. If you need clarification, however, he's there to help.

Dr. Karunwi is cool. He sometimes comes off a little rude or cynical but he does care and is actually nice. I thought Id get a low B but he gives way more than enough opportunities for you to pass. 4 tests with the lowest dropped, final, homework and recitation attendance. There is LOTS of EC available for each exam. Ended up with over a 100.

4 test and a final. lowest test dropped. webassign homework. all questions on test come from hw, class powerpoints that he posts online, and recitation. allows for an index card on each test. final is worth 30% of grade. Up to 50 bonus points on each test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Straightforward guy who is more than willing to help. His explanations could use some work though. A couple of weeks in he started giving bonuses for labs turned in at the end of class. He also drops a lab at the end of the semester.

So initially he comes off kinda of rude, but he's actually a pretty straight guy. Had him for lab. He covers some very basic formulas and explanations before the lab, and he won't walk around and check on you. Which is great is you don't need help, but if you do, you'll have to be the one to initiate any conversation. Pay attention to graphs/units!

Took him for lab. All the lab work and the write up plus graph is due at the end of the class. Very little help from him plus he is a harsh grader( grades out of 10 and -2.5 for graph, -1 for wrong measurements/ missing ones and so on. It takes more points than it gives.). To be honest is 1 credit class and he makes it more hard than it should be.

I had him for intro physics 1, and 2. Got a B in 1 and an A in 2. He gives lots of extra credit. Tests are usually made up of homework and recitation questions, and are multiple choice and short answer. There is no way you can fail his class. I put forth minimum effort. Also, He will help you if you need it. Just ask. Take him if you want an A!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took for 4 week summer session, four tests, dropped one, lots of homework to boost grade, 90% of the problems are on chegg, tests straight from hw, puts powerpoints online after lecture, got over 100 on every test with minimal studying, gives lots of extra credit , definitely had to put in some effort and time but worth it. Ended up with a 103

Wish i didn't read these reviews. Professor Karunwi's class was so hard, and this was the beginners physics. The study material doesn't prepare you for the tests. I've always been amazing at physics and had a lot of trouble with this class. Definitely won't be taking him again.

Class was easy. But beware!! It was his first time teaching so he went easy on us. He's going to be much harder for any future students who are considering taking him! He's a really smart Professor with a phD so be prepared for a rigorous class if you take him.

Actually cares about his students, will answer any questions. He lives room for extra credit on tests. His lectures are from the book so it's not really needed. He did make attending breakout count towards your grade, but you should go he helps the class workout homework problems.

Dr. Karunwi was great. It was his first time teaching, so I am assuming the class will get harder as he gains experience. Homework was time-consuming, but it prepares you well for tests, which are fairly easy if you know the homework material. He is really, really sweet and cares a lot about his students, even if you are struggling.

Dr. Karunwi was the easiest A I ever made. His tests were out of 150 points but only 100 count, so you could make up to 50 bonus points on the tests. He also offers extra credit. If you show up to class, take, notes, and do the homework, there is no reason not to get an A. He also extends the deadlines for homework often.

TAKE HIM!!! Dr. Karunwi is a great professor! 4 exams, web assign homework, and a final. Can drop lowest exam or opt out of final. Lots of extra credit. Gives a possible 150 point on each exam but takes your score out of 100. Exam questions come directly from HW and his PP so you've already seen the questions. Really helpful in recitation class.
